author: A_Brickset_user
title: Nice but to pricy
review:
It's a big green plate, what more is there to review. Other than it's to little or it's to much money (10 euro).
But truth be told, without it my buildings wouldn't be so easy to build or wouldn't stay up long enough to enjoy seeing my daughter play with them.
It's a MUST HAVE for Duplo builders.

author: Legonidas
title: Essential piece for playing, and motor skills
review:
As you get kids, you will inevitably get/need some Duplo sets, the problem with Duplo sets is they look nice on the boxes with the drawn background, but they are of course not included with the set. You are only getting a few ( REALLY cute) figures and building blocks.

Without this building plate, the duplo set will just become a normal toy without utilizing Duplo's main draw which is building stuff and getting those fine motor skills going. The plate also gives more stability and structure to the building experience, and is also a good way to keep your Duplo somewhat together.

Pro: Compared to knockoffs you really see the quality of Lego. While this board stays flat (with normal use) some knockoffs come with a complimentary bend (because they are made too thin to save on cost) which make it hard for blocks to be placed on the board and impossible to keep them on it.

Con: Price and most kids don't play too long with Duplo. For this price one would expect more variation like roads/rivers or other terrain features. This would also entice people to buy more than 1.
